code: @Manual{,   title = {crimemappingdata: Data For Learning Crime Mapping},   author = {Matt Ashby},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.3.0},   url = {https://pkgs.lesscrime.info/crimemappingdata}, }

title: Data For Learning Crime Mapping
text: crimemappingdata package contains variety datasets useful learning crime mapping. datasets used crimemapping package also available use anyone else accordance licence shown documentation dataset.

title: Data For Learning Crime Mapping
text: can install development version crimemappingdata GitHub :

title: Data For Learning Crime Mapping
text: following datasets available, : R data can called using data() function, e.g. data(aggravated_assaults), stand-alone files can downloaded formats shown . See manual page dataset (e.g. ?aggravated_assaults) corresponding stand-alone file URL. Different stand-alone datasets provided different file formats (including spatial non-spatial formats) give opportunity students practice loading files different types (e.g. using readr::read_csv() readxl::read_excel()). Note gzipped CSV files (file extension .csv.gz) can opened using readr::read_csv() functions packages, base::read.csv(). can find details dataset vignette vignette("dataset_summary").

title: Data For Learning Crime Mapping
text: suggestions use data package teaching, well details dataset, see vignette vignette("teaching").

title: Data For Learning Crime Mapping
text: package licensed MIT Licence, individual datasets licensed data provider using variety different open-data licences. Check manual page dataset details relevant licence. Users responsible using data accordance applicable licence dataset.
